content.html:
I just tested building on trusty with -DUSE_EXTERNAL_URDF=True, so that it ends up using the system versions of urdfdom 0.2. I'm getting compilation warnings and a test seg-fault:

[sdformat] /home/scpeters/ws/sdformat/src/sdformat/src/parser_urdf.cc: In function void ReduceCollisionToParent(UrdfLinkPtr, const string&, UrdfCollisionPtr):

content.raw: That seems like it's hiding a regression, since the tests pass with urdfdom 0.2 on the `sdf3` branch. Is that the only option?
content.html: That seems like it's hiding a regression, since the tests pass with urdfdom 0.2 on the sdf3 branch. Is that the only option?

content.raw: I am commenting out a new test that will not pass for the old code, so it's not a regression.  To be more precise, the new test exercises bugs in the old code using urdfdom 0.2 that are not exercised by the old tests, and the old code is not working correctly even before this pull request.
content.html: I am commenting out a new test that will not pass for the old code, so it's not a regression. To be more precise, the new test exercises bugs in the old code using urdfdom 0.2 that are not exercised by the old tests, and the old code is not working correctly even before this pull request.

content.raw:
cc @iche033 @chapulina 

Are there any problems with using `::` separators in collision names? These are generated by the URDF parser.
content.html:
cc @iche033 @chapulina

Are there any problems with using :: separators in collision names? These are generated by the URDF parser.

content.raw: various parts of the model editor looks for the `::` string to find the leaf names of visuals and collisions so I think this may cause some issues. If we want to be able to support `::` in entity names we should really  start changing the logic for parsing names in the model editor
content.html: various parts of the model editor looks for the :: string to find the leaf names of visuals and collisions so I think this may cause some issues. If we want to be able to support :: in entity names we should really start changing the logic for parsing names in the model editor

content.raw:
For fixed joint reduction, the hardcoded `lump::` prefix is randomly(badly) chosen, sole purpose is to try and create unique names after a reduction.
The prefix here can be changed without issues as long as it produces a unique naming scheme.

Is/should the `::` symbol (or `/`) be reserved for some kind of special scoping use? On the other hand, can the structure of parent/child hierarchy be deduced using C++ API calls?
content.html:
For fixed joint reduction, the hardcoded lump:: prefix is randomly(badly) chosen, sole purpose is to try and create unique names after a reduction. The prefix here can be changed without issues as long as it produces a unique naming scheme.

Is/should the :: symbol (or /) be reserved for some kind of special scoping use? On the other hand, can the structure of parent/child hierarchy be deduced using C++ API calls?

content.raw:
yeah, we currently use `::` as a separator for scoped names:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/c62677a754d/gazebo/physics/Base.cc#Base.cc-320
content.html:
yeah, we currently use :: as a separator for scoped names:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/c62677a754d/gazebo/physics/Base.cc#Base.cc-320

content.raw: I'll make a new pr to change `lump::` to something else.
content.html: I'll make a new pr to change lump:: to something else.

here you go

content.html: cool thanks for make the change
